asset.name: Application
asset.significance: Vulnerable resources and ill-defined application policies can compromise data and devices associated with an application.

security_property.rationale: A danger that resources and keys might get ripped off. From a developer's perspective, Confidentiality is more important than Integrity.
Spoofing authority could lead to unauthorised changes to a package.

asset.name: Personal Zone Administration Console
asset.description: The web interface used to control the personal zone.
asset.significance: Used to authenticate significant actions in the personal zone, such as revoking and adding devices and connecting to other users.

security_property.rationale: Losing access to the PZH Admin console would result in many features being offline, as well as preventing users from responding to attacks or revoking malicious devices
Because the administration console can be used to add and remove webinos devices and alter policies, accountability of who performed the actions is important.

asset.name: Analytics Data
asset.description: Analytics Data collected by webinos and made available to other applications.
asset.significance: If not properly controlled, analytics data could be disclosed or tampered with by unauthorised subjects.

security_property.rationale: The analytics data is shielded by the PZP, this only stores the data.
The offered analytics data needs to be accurate, otherwise developers will find ways of working around it.
Analytics data has to be linkable to a certain user. Analytics data also needs to be available at the cost of privacy.

asset.name: Event
asset.description: An object incorporating messaging attributes and additional webinos specific payload data and meta-data
asset.significance: Event messaging attributes are potentially spoofable. Vulnerabilities intrinsic to the underlying technology, e.g. XMPP, JSON, also weaken webinos events.

security_property.rationale: Tampering with the contents of event data could lead to the circumvention of other security controls.
Loss of event data leads to gradual degradation of webinos services and any applications depending on these events.
Events should only be interpretable by authorised events.

asset.name: Identity Provider
asset.description: Interface through which an Identity Provider registers and provides authentication credentials.
asset.significance: webinos may fall back on a less secure backup if this is not available.

asset.name: Resource
asset.description: Resource used by an application, e.g. HTML, JavaScript, CSS
asset.significance: Compromised resources may compromise the entire application.

security_property.rationale: A danger that resources and keys might get ripped off. From a developer's perspective, Confidentiality is more important than Integrity.

asset.name: Browser
asset.significance: Some level of privacy needs to hold when connecting to the web.

asset.name: Virtual Machine
asset.description: Virtual Machine running on a cloud provider
asset.significance: Compromising the VM potential compromises any applications or webinos components running on the VM.

security_property.rationale: Tampering with VM may circumvent security measures webinos relies on.

asset.name: Node Instance
asset.description: Server or client side Node.js process

security_property.rationale: Tampering with node may circumvent security measures webinos relies on.
webinos instances have some reliance on node for accessing personal zone capabilities.

asset.name: Personal Media Preferences
asset.significance: Loss of preferences increases setup time when integrating with different media.

security_property.rationale: Lack of availability to these preferences is an annoyance more than anything else. Without persona preferences the user needs to manually setup the device.
Personal media preferences may store very sensitive data, e.g. credit card number used for "pay per view" services.

asset.name: Device API
asset.significance: Manipulates device features and accesses privacy-sensitive data

security_property.rationale: Tampering with device APIs may compromise the generation of session related events necessary for maintaining the integrity of session and identity data.
Changes made to the API need to be tracked to make sure only authorised entities can do this.

asset.name: Privacy Preferences
asset.description: The privacy preferences associated with a user.
asset.significance: Ambiguous, ignored or non-existing user privacy preferences may lead to an application betraying user's privacy expectations.

security_property.rationale: Don't want applications to send subject data back to a provider.

asset.name: Personal Data
asset.description: Data that is personal to a webinos user.
asset.significance: Consequences of data loss are unpredictable

asset.name: Session
asset.description: State data associated with a running instance of an application on a device.
asset.significance: Compromised session data might be used by an attacker to obtain data from other authorised webinos devices.

security_property.rationale: Disclosed sessions enable access to webinos data and services on devices within a personal zone.
Compromised sessions may lead to malicious modification of webinos data and services.
